meanings.sent1: Her dilatory behavior in submitting assignments often led to late grades.
meanings.sent2: The dilatory student always waited until the last minute to start homework.
meanings.sent3: The dilatory turtle took its time crossing the road, much to the amusement of onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The dilatory snail made the race an exercise in patience for the other competitors.
meanings.sent5: The dilatory clouds seemed to drag their feet across the sky, delaying the sunset.

meanings.sent1: The dilatory tactics of the lawyer were evident in the constant requests for extensions.
meanings.sent2: The dilatory response from the government only served to prolong the issue.
meanings.sent3: The dilatory cat purposely knocked over the vase to delay dinner time.
meanings.sent4: The dilatory traffic lights seemed to conspire to make everyone late.
meanings.sent5: The dilatory excuses only added to the frustration of those waiting for an answer.

meanings.sent1: His dilatory nature often resulted in unfinished projects piled up on his desk.
meanings.sent2: The dilatory employee always found reasons to postpone important tasks.
meanings.sent3: The dilatory squirrel kept putting off gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The dilatory river meandered slowly through the valley, taking its time to reach the sea.
meanings.sent5: The dilatory decision-making process caused unnecessary delays in the project timeline.
